lanalytics
  • Reference

Rasch model plot with ggplot2

This function computes a graph of the ICC of the Rasch model

plot_group(quiz_object, email_filtered, df_exam = NULL)

Arguments

quiz_object

Receives as input the dataframe un long format of all quizzes (Generated with read_lc)

Value

A plot of the rasch model

Examples

file_to_read <- "../../datasets/sample_dataset/Q01.csv"
quiz_object_1 <- read_lc(file_to_read)
#> Parsed with column specification:
#> cols(
#>   .default = col_datetime(),
#>   `email address` = col_character(),
#>   `item01 score` = col_integer(),
#>   `item02 score` = col_integer(),
#>   `item03 score` = col_integer(),
#>   `item04 score` = col_integer(),
#>   `item05 score` = col_integer(),
#>   `item06 score` = col_integer(),
#>   `item07 score` = col_integer(),
#>   `item08 score` = col_integer(),
#>   `item09 score` = col_integer(),
#>   `item10 score` = col_integer(),
#>   `item11 score` = col_integer()
#> )
#> See spec(...) for full column specifications.
#> Joining, by = c("email address", "question")
file_to_read <- "../../datasets/sample_dataset/Q02.csv"
quiz_object_2 <- read_lc(file_to_read)
#> Parsed with column specification:
#> cols(
#>   .default = col_datetime(),
#>   `email address` = col_character(),
#>   `item01 score` = col_integer(),
#>   `item02 score` = col_integer(),
#>   `item03 score` = col_integer(),
#>   `item04 score` = col_integer(),
#>   `item05 score` = col_integer(),
#>   `item06 score` = col_integer(),
#>   `item07 score` = col_integer(),
#>   `item08 score` = col_integer(),
#>   `item09 score` = col_integer(),
#>   `item10 score` = col_integer(),
#>   `item11 score` = col_integer()
#> )
#> See spec(...) for full column specifications.
#> Joining, by = c("email address", "question")
file_to_read <- "../../datasets/sample_dataset/Q03.csv"
quiz_object_3 <- read_lc(file_to_read)
#> Parsed with column specification:
#> cols(
#>   .default = col_datetime(),
#>   `email address` = col_character(),
#>   `item01 score` = col_integer(),
#>   `item02 score` = col_integer(),
#>   `item03 score` = col_integer(),
#>   `item04 score` = col_integer(),
#>   `item05 score` = col_integer(),
#>   `item06 score` = col_integer(),
#>   `item07 score` = col_integer(),
#>   `item08 score` = col_integer(),
#>   `item09 score` = col_integer(),
#>   `item10 score` = col_integer(),
#>   `item11 score` = col_integer()
#> )
#> See spec(...) for full column specifications.
#> Joining, by = c("email address", "question")
file_to_read <- "../../datasets/sample_dataset/Q04.csv"
quiz_object_4 <- read_lc(file_to_read)
#> Parsed with column specification:
#> cols(
#>   .default = col_datetime(),
#>   `email address` = col_character(),
#>   `item01 score` = col_integer(),
#>   `item02 score` = col_integer(),
#>   `item03 score` = col_integer(),
#>   `item04 score` = col_integer(),
#>   `item05 score` = col_integer(),
#>   `item06 score` = col_integer(),
#>   `item07 score` = col_integer(),
#>   `item08 score` = col_integer(),
#>   `item09 score` = col_integer(),
#>   `item10 score` = col_integer(),
#>   `item11 score` = col_integer()
#> )
#> See spec(...) for full column specifications.
#> Joining, by = c("email address", "question")
quiz_object <- bind_rows(list(quiz_object_1, quiz_object_2, quiz_object_3, quiz_object_4))
final_exam <- "../../datasets/sample_dataset/finalexam_file.csv"
final_exam <- read_csv(final_exam)
#> Parsed with column specification:
#> cols(
#>   `email address` = col_character(),
#>   `final exam` = col_double()
#> )
email_filtered <- "UTKIJ1509E@gmail.com"
plot_group(quiz_object, email_filtered, final_exam)
#> Joining, by = "email address"
